title: Workflows Gallery: Create and document tasks in less than 5 min

subtitles.srt: today I'm sharing a really useful workflow that I use within chat GPT alongside flow and the main use case is to facilitate task creation or any requests that I may have for external vendors or internal team members so what I have already set up is a custom GPT which will provide me um a short form output and a longer form output based on the task that I want completed and then I can use this output either in a slack message in an email or even documented in notion so as an example I'll hit FN in space I've been reviewing the author collection pages and notice that the um authos schema markup is missing can we please add the authos schema in Json LD and add a same as object so that we can reference the social profiles of the author that's about it now obviously I do know what the task is uh and I have context of the task and then once I dictate it in I simply hit enter this will give me the output um as mentioned I can use this in slack and this I would um document within the task management system so this is what that would look like go to notion where I document my task add author schema to the author's collection Pages done open this task and I would simply copy this out paste it back in here and assign this to me now obviously I'd first want to review this but something that I've noticed is that jbt uh you know lays it out quite nicely and includes things that I may not have thought about so from here on out I just make notes um and then share this with the responsible team members or external vendors um hope you found this useful cheers

title: Stop Typing, Start Talking to AI (Wispr Flow Walkthrough)
text:
ðŸ—“ï¸ | Book a free consultation: https://cal.com/mohamed-sonor/chat
â€”â€”â€”
ðŸ¤ | Work with us: www.sonorai.co
ðŸŒ | LinkedIn: Â Â /Â elgazzar-mohamedÂ Â 
â€”â€”â€”
ðŸŽ™ï¸ | Vapi (affiliate): https://vapi.ai/?aff=mo

â€”â€”â€”

ðŸ“„ Description
I used to hate writing long prompts for AI tools until I discovered Whisperflow. This tool lets you just talk out loud and turns your words into clean, structured prompts for ChatGPT or Claude. It makes brainstorming, writing, and even sales prep so much easier. In this video, Iâ€™ll walk you through how I use it and why it completely changed the way I interact with AI.

â€”â€”â€”

â±ï¸ Timestamps
0:00 ðŸ“ž Why typing prompts is broken
0:38 ðŸ”§ Intro to Whisperflow
1:11 ðŸ¤– How to talk directly to your AI
2:22 âœ… Brainstorming and writing with voice
3:03 ðŸŽ¯ Using Whisperflow for sales prep

subtitles.srt: I used to really hate writing long prompts in my AI tools like chat GPT or claude and you know it was would make typos. I would lose my train of thought. It would be just like a consuming task. Then I discovered whisperflow which is able to take everything that I said and it's able to pretty much transfer it into proper formatted correct text. Hey, if we haven't met yet, I'm Mo from SAI and we build voice agents for small to mediumsiz businesses. And if you're interested to see how the technology could actually look into your business, then I do invite you for a free consultation. I leave links in the description below. And with that said, let's jump right into it. So yeah, here is the landing page of Whisper Flow. And to be clear, I'm not affiliated with this company at all. I just really love what they have offered. Um, and just want to share how much it changed the way that I interact with LLM models. So the idea is that you are let's say faced uh with claude or chd and the beautiful thing is that you're just able to pretty much click and you just talk out loud. So that means that you're able to really put out everything that you have in your head and you're able to give it as context into the LLM model of choice which in turn is going to really improve the way that you're going to um interact with the LM and thus the outputs are going to be as close as you know you actually wanted. So yeah, now if I type back, you can see that I will receive everything that I said. Um, and it's especially useful for example when it comes to brainstorming. So if you have a few ideas scattered around your head, um what I personally like to do is actually just like talk out loud, keep it there, have pauses, think and then let's say just overall ask the LM to then you know like give you a structured uh you know way to think about what you just said. Um or you you know you have something that is perhaps difficult to explain in writing. So what you do is that you just talk it out loud. And I found myself that it's really helping um when it comes to the uh also the thinking process that goes through it. And another handy way to use this tool is actually you know to respond to any email or any message that you receive like WhatsApp or personal or whatever. Um and you would just like quickly uh type it. And for those of you that are, let's say, like very specific and you want to be clean and clear when you write something, you just like type out or like dictate out what you want to respond with and just like go to FL LM or JP then ask it to improve what you uh your message uh essentially. So that is a really handy way uh to use whisper flow as well. And a interesting way that I actually like to use it is also when it comes to my sales preparation. So if I know that I have a sales call tomorrow and I want to be prepared um I try to go through let's say the outline of the sale the sales call uh and I just talk it through and I realize that whenever I talk it through I tend to have like diff different observations that I might not have thought of um if I just stayed in my head and had to type it or write it. So it's a really beautiful thing to like train but also yeah find different nuances um that you could leverage in your uh sales call and then you put it into the LM prop then it could think for you like in a more u dynamic way so you could find different pockets um of you know insights that you might have not realized yourself and it's really good to give you feedback um on let's say the approach that you want to Um so I really advise to use it for uh let's say this sales uh let's say preparation it can be really really handy. All right so with that said that was it for the introduction of whisper flow. Uh I hope this tool can be beneficial. Um if you've never used such a thing and I mean you don't have to use whisper flow necessarily. You could even just like go into the envel. Yeah, exactly. So, you're able to directly dictate what you want and yeah, it's it's a really good way to just like leverage uh let's say this feature to give context to VLM so it can really help you battle out. Cool. With that said, I thank you so much. Hope this was helpful and see you in the next

subtitles.srt: Ever feel like your thoughts flow faster than your fingers can type? Yeah, that's because they actually do. We speak almost three times faster than we type. Which means every time you're stuck hammering on a keyboard, your ideas are already miles ahead. So, what do you do? You go to voice to text tools like Whisper Flow. They let you speak naturally and turn your words into text instantly. While whisper flow makes the process beautifully simple, it does have a lot of hiccups with background noise, editing control, and device compatibility. So, if you love Whisper Flow but wish it did just a little more, here are five powerful alternatives that take voice to text to the next level. [Music] So, let's start with the first one, ClickUp. ClickUp is the world's first converged AI workspace built to end work in AI sprawl. With its talkto text feature, you can capture ideas up to four times faster than typing in over 40 languages. And because it's powered by contextaware AI, it recognizes your teammates names, your projects, and even document titles as you speak. Then there's Brainax, your desktop AI super app that keeps your entire workspace connected. It can search through every note, doc, or task within your ClickUp workspace and connected apps to pull answers to get work done in seconds. ClickUp makes sure you never lose your best ideas to context switching and tab hopping. It's the one intelligent workspace that brings everything together. Moving on to our next tool, Otter AI. Otter listens to your conversations in real time and types them out verbatim for you. No matter what meeting you're taking or when you need the summary, Otter can figure things out for you. But remember, Otter sometimes needs a tuneup. If there's a lot of background noise or people talking over each other, you may not get the best results. Still, for fast and easy note-taking, Otter is a real lifesaver. Now, if Otter is your meeting sidekick, then Sony's AI is the language wizard, just one that lives in your pocket. Sonox is great if you've got teammates from different countries or you need your notes in more than one language. You just drop in your audio or video, and Sonics turns it to text in over 40 languages with no problem. You can polish your transcript, highlight the important stuff, and share it with others. But here's the catch. If you're using it a lot, you'll probably need to pay for extra transcriptions once the free trial runs out. The fourth tool on our list is Mac Whisper. This one is just for Mac users. What's cool about Mac Whisper is that it works even if you don't have internet access. Since everything is stored locally on your computer, your notes are also private and safe. Just record your voice and Mac Whisper turns it into text. No cloud dependency. No worries. The only thing is if you're not a Mac user, you're out of luck. Mac Whisper doesn't work on Windows or mobile devices. Last but not least, we have dictote. Dictote is kind of like talking to yourself. You can speak freely and it writes down what you say. You can even use voice in it. It's speechto text extension on the Chrome web store. This reduces the need for fast internet and helps keep your voice data more private. Dictote works best on Google Chrome. So, if you're using a different browser or want to use it on your phone, it might not be the perfect fit for you. And that wraps up our list. Five awesome alternatives to Whisper. Whether you want something for your team, need notes in different languages, or just want to keep things private, there's a tool here for you. Try them out and see which one makes your life easier. And hey, if you want accurate transcription that feeds into your work, plus a little AI magic, check out ClickUp at the link in the description.

title: Introducing WISPR SkyScout2 Series
text:
Introducing the #1 American-made surveying, mapping, and inspection drone on the market. 

The WISPR SkyScout2 series is built with professionals in mind to deliver precision, reliability, and performance. SkyScout2 redefines whatâ€™s possible in professional drone operations.

Key Features-
â€¢ Seamless RTK & PPK integration - no additional base station required
â€¢ SignalSheildâ„¢ Industry-leading EMI protection 
â€¢ TempGuardâ„¢ climate control, heat, and cold protection
â€¢ PathGuardâ„¢ collision avoidance
â€¢ Auto-Land Capabilities
â€¢ Hot-swappable batteries and S-Port quick-attach payload system
â€¢ Optional, blue-listed hand controller
â€¢ Unmatched GNSS coverage for superior accuracy and signal reliability
â€¢ Built in the USA for professionals who demand performance and dependability

Learn MoreðŸ‘‰ https://wisprsystems.com/skyscout2/

Schedule a demo todayðŸ‘‰https://calendly.com/jmcarthur-wispr/...

subtitles.srt: The next [music] evolution in precision drone technology has arrived. Introducing the Sky Scout 2 and Sky Scout 2 Plus from Whisper Systems. An Americanmade [music] leader in drone technology. Designed with input from professionals in surveying, mapping, and inspection, Skyscout 2 delivers greater performance, resilience, and operator control. Fly further, safer, and more efficiently with key enhancements in this next generation of drone [music] technology. The SP quick attach system increases payload capacity to more than 3 and 12 lbs without sacrificing flight time. Tempguard's dynamic [music] climate control intelligently regulates air flow to keep components at peak operating temperature even in extreme [music] hot or cold environments. Smart Core, our smart power distribution system provides built-in protection against potential battery failures and a redundant [music] management system for maximum flight safety. The precision terrain follow system [music] with whispers terrain sense delivers unmatched altitude accuracy, better high altitude terrain mapping, and reliable lowaltitude guidance where GPS and barometers fall [music] short. The Pathguard longrange obstacle detection system features front and rear obstacle sensors with an amazing 164 ft range to help protect [music] the aircraft during mapping missions and manual flight. Signal Shield are electromagnetic inference [music] shielding, allowing operators to safely fly closer to power lines, cell towers, and other EMI sources without compromising [music] control, reliability, or data integrity. Skyscout 2 Plus delivers accurate, consistent fieldready data. Built for [music] dependable performance when it matters. From survey and mapping to inspection, Skyscout 2 Plus [music] delivers data you can trust and results you can use. Finally, Sky Scout 2 Plus adds the Whisper Sky [music] Boss smart controller, revolutionizing the operator experience. It combines a 7-in [music] screen with a brightness readable in sunlight and a rugged design that meets high standards for protection from drops and bad weather. Secure encrypted [music] transmission between the controller and drone ensures mission integrity, while multiple roll wheels, hot swappable batteries, and up to [music] 6 hours of runtime keep pilots in control all day. Mission planning on the Whisper Sky Boss is effortless with Whisper [music] ground control. Set flight paths in a few clicks and adapt on the fly. Ground control keeps missions seamless from start to finish. Precision, [music] durability, and compliance. Engineered by one of the most trusted US drone manufacturers, the Skyscout 2 and Sky Scout 2 Plus empower professionals to work [music] faster, longer, and with the confidence that only Whisper Innovation can provide. Whisper Sky [music] Scout 2 Plus, now NDAA compliant.

subtitles.srt: Hello guys, in this video I'm going to make the comparison between whisper flow versus super whisper. Which voice detection tool is better? Whisper flow in the super whisper are both tools built on open AIS which model for speech to test voice detection but they have different strength depending on your use case. When you use whisper flow, you are mainly doing real time detection inside your browser. You want voice commands like com like punctuation and the formatting. You work in Google Docs, notion, Gmail and so forth. But when you use super whisper, you need offline private or bulk transcription. you often transcribe and record audio files or voice notes and with super whisper you can use Mac OS and native applications. So to conclude the best for realtime detection is in browser is whisper flow and the best for offline transcription and privacy is super whisper. So that's all for this video. If you find it helpful, like, subscribe, and see

title: Processing WISPR 24 Mapper in Pix4Dmatic- Walkthrough
text:
This video is a walkthrough on how to process the WISPR 24 Mapper in Pix4Dmatic.

Help determining the output coordinate system: https://geodesy.noaa.gov/SPCS/maps.shtml

WISPR Systems: https://wisprsystems.com/

*Image coordinate reference system switches to Ellipsoid May 2025.*

title: Mission Planning for Inertial Labs LiDAR using WISPR Ground Control (old)
text: How to plan missions using WISPR Ground Control with Inertial Labs LiDAR.

subtitles.srt: Mission planning with inertial Labs lidar using whisper Ground Control connect smart controller to mobile hotspot if maps are not pre-downloaded swipe down and click the Wi-Fi icon and connect to mobile hotspot then click the square and swipe right power on drone prior to opening whisper Ground Control open whisper Ground Control click the top left button to go to general settings select payload and then select recipe xt32 lidar you have the option to change manual or Mission flight speed change Mission flight speed to 5 meters per second for best results after completion click paper airplane button to return to in-flight screen click Mission planning button to begin planning mission set Waypoint altitude click take off button click pattern button click survey button click new basic pattern button play in polygon around survey area after polygon is planned select done with polygon you have the option to change your front and side overlap fifty percent front and side overlap are default slide the angle slider to rotate your flight line paths select terrain to enable terrain follow during your missions if needed click return button when you have finished Mission planning click upload required to send mission to drone click the button in the top left to return to the in-flight screen exit out of the start Mission slider to take off manually soft press button on lidar to power on unit and wait 30 seconds soft press button on lidar to start scanning and wait 30 seconds prior to taking off arm and takeoff drone manually and fly up to Mission altitude best practice to fly outside of mission path to start lidar calibration click lidar calibration button and Slide the slider to begin Slide the lidar calibration slider to begin calibration drone will run auto calibration and then begin Auto mission after landing remove plan from vehicle and close app soft press button on lidar to stop scanning and wait 30 seconds press and hold lidar button for 10 seconds to power off unit unplug battery from drone and you are complete

So, the the the big one that's coming down the pipe right now is going to be the new Teladine Echo1. >> Mhm. >> Um it's a completely NDAA compliant LAR that's half a centimeter accuracy. That doesn't have any. >> Correct. one in my opinion. Um, they now have an RTK unit that you can put on top of that that you probably saw over at their booth. That's going to bring them well more into the photogometry and surveying and mapping market >> cuz surveyors are completely trained in RTK and they're not going to fly a photography mission without it. >> No. And >> so for the last year and a half that we've had that unit out, we've predominantly sold it with either inspection or LAR. Yeah, I could see if you like it because like you don't have to buy such an expensive drone for just inspection. >> Well, but you do if it has to be US. >> Yeah, that's true. >> Okay. title: WISPR HACK... HIGHER TEMP = BETTER VAPOR CLOUD
text: Hack your WISPR for higer temperature and better vapor cloud.NO TOOLS, NO FUSS, NOOO WAAAAY!(yes way!)

subtitles.srt: hey what's up fellow vapers what we have here is the ever-popular iolite whisperer now a lot of people have been saying hey you know what this is a great unit but it lacks temperature control well I've found a way around that and here's what you do when you initially fire up your unit you notice that the LED or the burner indicator lamp it stays on for several seconds longer you know on the initial startup because it's cold and then what will happen is it'll reach its temperature and periodically turn on and turn off the best way to hack this unit for a higher temperature is you start beating it up let it cycle you know four times provided that your indoor you know at about 70 degrees and then shut the unit off and then wait about two minutes and reignite the unit and what's gonna happen is your chamber is already warmed up but by shutting unit off and then reigniting it after about two minutes you're achieving a longer burn the heating chamber it's actually bringing the temperature up way higher they know fewer just initially left it on and let it cycle it worked great for me and I can guarantee you if you're a whisper owner and you've been unsatisfied with the vapor quality try this and I'll guarantee you you'll have a whole new respect for this

title: Wispr Flow & Superwhisper Alternative â€“ 100% FREE & Super Accurate Voice-to-Text
text:
The tool I'm introducing today is quite remarkableâ€”it might be the most powerful speech input software currently available.
Whisper Input is an open-source code repository on GitHub. I've translated it into English and introduced the simplest local deployment method.

https://github.com/leosimon/Whisper-I...
https://github.com/leosimon/Whisper-I...

subtitles.srt: Being able to express our thoughts directly in natural language is definitely much faster than typing. This is also a prerequisite for vital coding. The tool I'm introducing today is quite remarkable. It might be the most powerful speech input software currently available. Let me show you the results first. This software is based on OpenAI's whisper which is currently the best speech text tool available. Today I will introduce you two methods. The first one is an open-source code repository on GitHub. Awesome. This is super cool. Okay. And How about this? However, for most people, deploying this tool, deploying this code directly from Mac OS can be quite challenging. So, I've done two things. First, I translated it into English. Second, I summarized the simplest local deploy method. I believe that the vast majority of people should be able to master it following my tutorial. You see the results is so accurate. Of course, if you still find my steps too cumbersome, you can jump to the end of the video for the second method, installing a whisper keyboard application. That's a mature paid software with a $10 monthly subscription fee, but it might be more convenient to use. All right, without further ado, let's start explaining the complete free local deployment method for whisper input. Let's make sure you have Python 3.10 or higher installed on your Mac. Open terminal and type. You should see version 3.10 or higher. If not, please install Python first. Download the project. Let's start by downloading the source code. In your terminal, navigate to where you want to install the project and run these two commands. Step two, get your API key. You'll need an API key from Croc. Visit console.croc.com. Create account if you don't have one and copy your API key. We'll use this in the next step. Step three, initial setup. Now let's run the setup script. First run this code. Then run this. The script will create av file for you. When prompt edit this file and add your configuration. Basically, you need to set service platform to Krogue and set uh CRUG API key to the actual API key we got from step two. Step four, system permissions. This is the most important step. This app needs two permissions to work properly. Go to system preferences. Select privacy and security. Select accessibility. Then find terminal in the list and check the box. Also under privacy and security select microphone and find terminal and check the box. Launch the application. Now you are ready to start. Run this code. You should see initialization message and voice assistant started. That means it's working. Using whisper input is simple. Hold the option key and speak. Release to transcribe your speech. The text will appear at your cursor position in any application. The final step is optional. If you want to launch the app more easily, you can create a desktop shortcut using Automator. First open Automator from your application folder. Then select application as a document type. Next search for run shell script in the actions library and drag it to your workflow area. In the script box, enter a script in the video description session. Make sure to replace the path with your actual project path. Save this as an application to your desktop or application folder. Now you can doubleclick this app to start whisper input without opening the terminal. That's it. You now have the most powerful speech to text tool running on your Mac. The setup only takes a few minutes, but the time you save using voice input will be enormous. Alternatively, if you prefer native Mac OS application, Whisper Keyboard is an excellent option. However, the free version only allows 20 sentences per day, which is definitely not enough for regular use. For unlimited sentences, you need to pay uh $10 per month. Uh that said, I believe whisper input is already good enough for most users. For more help, check the GitHub repository issues. Happy voice typing. I see you in the next one. Bye-bye. [Music] I'm on my way. [Applause]

title: Corridor Scans with Inertial Labs LiDAR using WISPR Ground Control (old)
text: How to plan corridor scans with Inertial Labs LiDAR using WISPR Ground Control

subtitles.srt: Corridor scan with inertial Labs lidar using whisper Ground Control connect smart controller to mobile hotspot if maps are not pre-downloaded swipe down and click the Wi-Fi icon and connect to mobile hotspot then click the square and swipe right power on drone prior to opening whisper Ground Control open whisper Ground Control click the top left button to go to general settings select payload and then select recipe xt32 lidar you have the option to change manual or Mission flight speed change Mission flight speed to 5 meters per second for best results after completion click paper airplane button to return to in-flight screen click Mission planning button to begin planning mission set Waypoint altitude click take off button click pattern button click Corridor scan button click new basic pattern button plain polygon around survey area after polygon is planned select done with polygon select terrain to enable terrain follow during your missions if needed click return button when you have finished Mission planning click upload required to send mission to drone click the button in the top left to return to the in-flight screen exit out of the start Mission slider to take off manually soft press button on lidar to power on unit and wait 30 seconds soft press button on lidar to start scanning and wait 30 seconds prior to taking off arm and takeoff drone manually and fly up to Mission altitude best practice to fly outside of mission path to start lidar calibration click lidar calibration button and Slide the slider to begin Slide the lidar calibration slider to begin calibration drone will run auto calibration and then begin Auto mission after landing remove plan from vehicle and close app soft press button on lidar to stop scanning and wait 30 seconds press and hold lidar button for 10 seconds to power off unit unplug battery from drone and you are complete

title: Updating WISPR Ground Control on Herelink Smart Controller
text: How to update WISPR Ground Control on Herelink Smart Controller

subtitles.srt: updating whisper Ground Control on Smart controller remove smart controller from case remove controller from Case by gently pulling up at the base of the antenna until it's out of the case download latest whisper Ground Control update next on your computer navigate to Whisperers systems.com under the support tab click downloads locate the most recent version of whisper ground control and click download Once downloaded navigate to your download folder click once on the zip file and then select extract all at the top of your browser plug the USB micro USB cable from computer to Smart controller power on Smart controller to install update plug in the US USB to micro USB cable from computer to Smart controller run install executable on computer to install update on Smart controller navigate into the extracted folder and select the windows folder if installing from a computer using Windows Windows will have a screen stating it protected your PC select run anyway accept the whisper terms and conditions stream install will be performed where the install will state if it's successful and to press any key to continue on your first update on your smart controller the message allow USB debugging will pop up when it does click the check box next to the description to always allow from this computer if you plan to use that computer in the future then click okay the unit will be good to update from this point whisper Ground Control update is now complete thank you for watching

title: WISPR SkyScout 2+ series
text: Overview video showcasing the new SkyScout 2+ series from WISPR Systems.

subtitles.srt: Introducing the next evolution in enterprise drone platforms from Whisper Systems, the Skyscout 2 Plus series. Our new flagship platform is designed to handle the toughest commercial applications. Skyscout 2 is purpose-built to be the endto-end solution for mapping, surveying, and inspection. Sky Scout 2 is a rugged small form drone with easy operation and swappable payloads for any mission. The setup is quick and streamlined so you are mission ready within minutes. [Music] Sport payload system. Quick attach mount that combines power and data into one secure interface making payload swap simple, fast, and flight ready. Smart core power system that delivers clean power and shields against battery faults, ensuring maximum flight safety, 40minute maximum flight time, an average of 30 minutes flight time with payload. Path guard obstacle detection, long range front and rear sensors with 164 ft coverage that protect the aircraft from hazards during autonomous missions and manual flight. Terrain sense precision following advanced altitude control that delivers unmatched accuracy from low-level inspections to high altitude mapping where GPS and barometers can't keep up. Teg Guard climate control intelligent heating and cooling that regulates air flow to keep components at peak performance in extreme hot or cold environments. Signal shield EMI protection. Best-in-lass shielding that blocks and dissipates interference, keeps avionics stable, sensors safe, and data clean even near power lines or towers. Precision positioning, integrated RTK with end trip and serial pass through, plus PPK geo tagging through whisper cloud for survey grade accuracy on every mission. 50 mph wind rating to keep you in the air even when situations are not the best. Whisper Sky Boss controller smart RC with a 7 in ultra bright 2000nit display, dual roll wheels, hot swappable batteries, and 6 plus hours of runtime built for all day control. Skyscout 2 Plus series utilizes whisper ground control which is a intuitive mission planning. Heads up display and in-flight controls are tailored to each payload. Whisper ground control ensures seamless aerial operations with a Sky Scout 2. Skyscout 2 is engineered with built-in reliability and redundancy, delivering a long life cycle with minimal upkeep, ensuring operators can count on consistent performance, lower costs, and mission success every time.

title: WISPR Smart Battery Firmware Update Guide
text:
This video is a walkthrough on how to update your WISPR Smart Batteries.

Download the update and update guide here: https://wisprsystems.atlassian.net/wi...
Link to Download Mission Planner:
https://ardupilot.org/planner/docs/mi...

subtitles.srt: Hey guys, Chris here from Whisper Systems. Today I'm going to be showing you how to update the firmware on your smart batteries. The first step is going to be connecting the adapter to the battery connector on the drone itself. And that'll just slide right on there like so. Once you have the adapter connected to the drone itself, you're just going to place the smart battery on top of that adapter. The next step is going to be connecting a USB from your laptop to the drone using the lower of the two ports. Next, open Mission Planner. If you don't have Mission Planner, there will be a download link in the description of this video. Once Mission Planner is open, you're going to want to go to this drop-own menu right here, select auto, and then click connect. Mission Planner will then pull the parameters from the drone. This will only take a few seconds. Once you're connected, you're going to want to navigate to setup in the top left. And then you're going to want to go to optional hardware. Then you'll want to go to drone canavan. And then you will select Mavink CAN 2 at the top. Once we're connected, we're going to want to find GBMS051601 and click menu and then go to parameters. And then we're going to want to change the parameters on system enable firmware updates from zero to one. And then we'll click write parameters. and click okay. And then we'll click okay one more time. Next, we're going to want to pay attention to that 119 right there. That's going to correlate to which file we're going to use to update each battery. It'll either be 118 or 119. We also want to pay attention to the firmware version. It'll change to 1.4.0 when we're done. And then we want to click menu and update. It's going to ask us if we want to search the internet. Click no. And then since this is CAN node 119, we are going to use the 119 file from the update folder. Click that and the update will begin. The first update is always going to fail. So we'll close that. And you'll notice a another node will pop up on the screen. We're going to go to the menu of that node. and click update. And then it'll ask us if we want to use the internet. Click no. And then once again, because the batteries node is 119, we'll use the 119 file. And this time, the update will proceed. The update will take anywhere from 15 to 20 seconds. Once the update is complete, you'll notice that the SW version next to the battery will change from 1.3.0 0 to 1.4.0. And now the update is complete. After you've completed updating the first battery, repeat the process on the second battery in the pair.

And you're wondering, well, how the hell do I get it out? Well, that's where this threaded tool comes in. You simply apply the screw screw it in and that will allow you to pull the bowl free. Now, as for popping the screen out, second tool, you're using the smaller end. You can just put that firmly on a table. and just insert it. Pressing down. [Applause] Oops. Well, should keep an eye on it because it can go flying out. But anyway, that's it. Done. Popped out. Hope that explains

title: Immigrant Founders: Convo with Tanay Kothari of Wispr Flow

subtitles.srt: Hey guys, I've been using this incredible app for the last few months. It's made my life amazingly useful. And today I had the good fortune to actually meeting Mr. Whisper Tan. Hey Tane, how are you buddy? >> Great to meet you, man. >> All right. Listen, we were having this conversation and you know, you've been an immigrant founder yourself. >> Yeah. >> Right. Right. And I want to just get a sense of what are the things that an immigrant founder finds, you know, maybe unfair, but you actually think it's it's not a liability. Give me a couple of things that you think are useful. >> That's actually the biggest thing. I think a lot of people have the mentality that being an immigrant is a liability and it's something that that deserves pity. But no, it's actually a superpower and it's something that I want people to be proud of. >> Okay? Because what you have as an immigrant is you are resourceful. You have gone through things over the years that have gotten you here in the first place. You have gone through a lot of people who said no to you repeatedly, but you still wanted to go past those obstacles. >> And I think that's a skill that and that's an opportunity that you have had in life that strengthens character. >> Okay. >> And the second thing immigrant immigrants have is honestly community. like there's thousands of people here right now all just to support each other >> and that's special. >> I absolutely love that. You know, one of the things that has happened to me in the last 2 months is I I moved to SF just 2 months ago and I've been posting a lot on LinkedIn and basically telling my friends and founders in India, you know, like the the AI action here is great, right? >> And what are two things you'd like to tell these founders who haven't yet booked their tickets to come to SF? what should they prepare for on this journey? >> The couple of things I'll say and this is coming from also having a lot of friends right now in India who are building companies and so I can compare and contrast. >> It is much much easier to raise funding here than it is in India and investors are way more happy to give you a lot more capital here which is fantastic. you probably see this yourself as a as a VC and even all my Indian founders are now raising from US VCs >> uh cuz it is better deals easier process all of the above and the second thing I'd say is if you are building in the space of actually pushing the frontier you're pushing the frontiers of AI you're pushing the frontiers of technology in any and always the ecosystem here actually supports you and promotes that they don't chase behind your gross margins and revenues and and all of that because what I think is unique about Silicon Valley is just the love for innovation >> and the realization that it takes it takes time and it takes energy and resources to actually build that and but that hard work is respected. >> Absolutely. I agree with you. Uh crazy anecdote, right? This founder messaged me on on LinkedIn in June that really I loved your content about coming to SF. I'm booking tickets. middle of July this person messages me that hey I'm landed can we meet >> right so it's the same day we met >> and 17 days later I get a WhatsApp update from him that beneath I've raised x million the speed here is incredible >> that's awesome this is exactly what happened 17 days yeah so thanks a lot for this man appreciate it and I'm hoping we'll catch up more in SF you're a neighbor done we'll make it happen thank you >> thank Yo.

title: LiDAR Missions with WISPR Ground Control
text: How to video showing how plan LiDAR missions with WISPR Ground Control.

subtitles.srt: click the W then click settings select payload then select light R payload reboot drone to set payload settings click W and then Mission planning set Mission altitude select Mission speed select takeoff this Auto sets takeoff where the Drone is and can be moved around option to change takeoff altitude on the left column select light R Cal and move lar calibration pattern as necessary on the left column select pattern select survey select basic pattern when complete click done with polygon adjust overlap input light R sensors field of view modify polygon height select to enable terrain follow adjust pattern angle click to rotate the entry point for the mission select to refly Mission at 90Â° offset more information about your survey is seen at the bottom on the left click return to set RTL location click upload to vehicle to upload mission to drone click W to return to inflight page click to view map view click to view video feed if flying light are manually Auto calibration button is available for manual flight slide to Auto takeoff and execute Mission or manually take off and slide to confirm to start mission after landing save from Mission start or clear Mission if mission was not complete then resume from last Waypoint option is available thank you for watching
